intro: Inula halleri, commonly known as the Haller's Inula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant produces small, rough, ribbed fruits. Inula halleri is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
